msIdentifier.collection: Civil War & Reconstruction Governors of Mississippi, Main Collection

note.p: Orson Hyde Crandall was a physician, Union soldier, and private secretary to a Mississippi governor during the Reconstruction era.

Born on March 31, 1827, in Cicero, New York, Crandall studied medicine at Cincinnati’s Eclectic School of Medicine and became a practicing physician in 1851. He moved to Illinois and volunteered for military service when the Civil War broke out in 1861. Crandall first enlisted in the Fifth Illinois Light Artillery before being appointed assistant surgeon of the Twenty-fourth Illinois Infantry Regiment. At the end of the war, Crandall served as a surgeon at a U.S. military post in Brookhaven, Mississippi. He remained there until being appointed private secretary to military governor Adelbert Ames in 1869. He returned to Illinois in 1870 and worked as a physician for several more years.

Crandall died on January 17, 1920. He was married twice, first to Emily Hitchcock, and later to Ruth Adelaide Patchin. He had at least two children. Crandall is buried in Woodland Cemetery in Quincy, Illinois.

(FindaGrave; “Crandall, Orson H.,” U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934; Tri-Weekly Clarion, Meridian, MS, March 27, 1869; 1870 Federal Census, Woodstock, McHenry, Illinois, Roll M593_257, p. 295B)
Orson Hyde Crandall belonged to the following social groups:

Located in Leake County, Carthage was established in 1834 under the name Leakville and was renamed Carthage on July 31, 1834. Carthage serves as the county seat. (Wikipedia; Atlas of Historical County Boundaries; Rowland, Mississippi, 376)
Located in Hinds County, Jackson was founded in 1822 and serves as one of two county seats of Hinds County and the state capital of Mississippi. (Britannica)

gloss.p: "The processing of individuals who have committed criminal acts." (Cambridge Dictionary)

"If someone who has committed a crime is pardoned, that person is officially forgiven and their punishment is stopped." (Cambridge Dictionary)"An act of mercy by a person in authority toward someone who has committed a crime, esp. by reducing a punishment." (Cambridge Dictionary)
"Individuals responsible for enforcing laws in designated areas." (Cambridge Dictionary)
"In the U.S., an official whose job is to be in charge of performing the orders of the law courts and making certain that the laws are obeyed within a particular county." (Cambridge Dictionary)
"A person with special training in the medical field." (Cambridge Dictionary)
"A medical doctor, especially one who has general skill and is not a surgeon." (Cambridge Dictionary)

Operating at the state level, the Executive Department of the State of Mississippi consists of the governor, lieutenant governor, secretary of state, state treasurer, state comptroller, commissioner of agriculture, commissioner of insurance, the Mississippi Public Service Commission, the Mississippi Transportation Commission, and attorney general. Each official is elected for a four-year term and is appointed duties pertaining to state regulations. (Wikipedia)

element.label: Description
element.value: From the Mississippi Department of Archives and History Governor Ames Collection. Letter from Samuel Young at Carthage, Mississippi, to O. H. Crandall at Jackson, Mississippi, concerning the receipt of an order of reprieve by the Sheriff of Leake County, Mississippi. Young requests Crandall reissue the reprieve.

div.fw: Letter from Samuel Young to O. H. Crandall; December 4, 1869
div.p:
Dr O H Crandall
Jackson Miss
I recd your note in regard to reprieve of Zack Wha-land, and came down to this place to see whither sheriff was in receipt of order of repreive.
I find the Sheriff absent and am not positively advised whether he has recd order or not, but from all the I can learn fear he has not—.

The time draws nigh and I fear the irregularity and uncertainty of mails. Will you please do me kindness, to enclose him again your order—in doing so allow me to suggest that you enclose it in plain envelope without any evidence on outside, of that communication comes from Executive Office.

Very Respy
Your frd & obt svt
